Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Suede \Suede\, Suede \Su[`e]de\(sw[=a]d, sw[asl]d, or sw[^a]d), n. [F., Sweden.] Swedish glove leather, -- usually made from lambskins tanned with willow bark. Also used adjectively; as, suede gloves. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Suede \Suede\, Suede \Su[`e]de\(sw[=a]d, sw[asl]d, or sw[^a]d), n. [F., Sweden.] Swedish glove leather, -- usually made from lambskins tanned with willow bark. Also used adjectively; as, suede gloves. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
suede n 1: leather with a napped surface 2: a fabric made to resemble suede leather [syn: {suede cloth}]
